COVID-19 Updates & Messages as it relates to KGCS
img.title: COVID-19 Updates & Messages as it relates to KGCS

h3.span: Updates and Letters from the Superintendent

p.span:
Most Recent Update - April 16th, 2020
Updates and Letters from the Superintendent of King George County Schools are available under COIVD-19 Updates and Messages link or by clicking the letter to the left.

div.p: During the closure of schools due to COVID-19, KGCS will provide "grab and go" meals on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays from 11:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. at the following locations: King George Elementary, King George High School, Potomac Elementary School, Sealston Elementary, and in Fairview Beach near the Shore Store. These meals are no cost and are for any child ages 2-18.

div.div: In accordance with the Governor's announcement, all King George County Schools will be closed for the remainder of the school year.

Like all schools in the Commonwealth of Virginia, King George County Schools are closed. Student learning is only one of the many evolving challenges that our families are facing in this uncertain time. Families are invited to continue academic practice during the closure using the resources suggested below. The health and well-being of our families remain our highest priority.
VIEW MORE About Learning Resources for School Closures

div.div: Access KGCS Instructional Programs from Home
With schools being closed through March 27, 2020 - KGCS would like families to know that their child can access resources through our Single Sign On portal - Clever. Click here to read more
